lunch.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a meal eaten in the middle of the day
lunch.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: I've just had lunch with John.
I’m afraid he’s at lunch until two.
A dozen senators met over lunch with the Chinese ambassador.
lunch.translation[0].definitions[0].note: You use at lunch to talk about something that happens while you are eating lunch
We can talk about it at lunch
You also use at lunch to say that someone has gone somewhere else to eat lunch
I went to see her, but she was at lunch
lunch.translation[0].note_box[0].section: What time do you usually eat lunch?
I usually have sandwiches for lunch.
He took her out for lunch at a local pub.
I don't often go out to lunch, as it's expensive.
Can you come to lunch tomorrow?
Why don't we break for lunch about 1 o'clock?
You clear the table while I make lunch.
After a light lunch, he would take a nap each afternoon.
Most of the children had brought packed lunches.
She was having a business lunch with a customer.
Free school lunches are provided for the poorest children.
Mum always cooks a chicken for Sunday lunch.
We took a half hour lunch break.
I try to go out for a walk during my lunch hour.
lunch.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: I will be lunching with a client.
I lunched on bread and olives.
lunch.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: a meal eaten in the middle of the day
lunch.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: facilities for conferences and private business lunches (=when business people go to lunch to discuss things or entertain customers)
He has working lunches (=when you discuss business and eat) with his team to develop their approach.
It is important that the office is manned during thelunch hour (=the time when people eat lunch).
lunch.translation[2].definitions[1].defi: used to say that something may seem free, but that you have to pay for it in the end
lunch.translation[2].definitions[2].defi: a lunch that is supposed to be a working lunch, but where people enjoy themselves too much to do any work
